util

Class SortAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.SortAlgorithm

  • public class SortAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to sort Dicoms.
    Author:
    dridder_local

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_BIRTHDATE
      The Default value for the Birth date, that is used, in case that the Birth date wasn't saved in the file.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_ECHONUMBERS
      The Default value for the number of echos, that is used, in case that the number of echos wasn't saved in the file.

      The Default value for the Image number, that is used, in case that the Image number wasn't saved in the file.

      The Default value for the instance uid, that is used, in case that the instance uid wasn't saved in the file.

      The Default value for the PatientID, that is used, in case that the PatientID wasn't saved in the file.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_PROCOLNAME
      The Default value for the Protocol name, that is used, in case that the Protocol name wasn't saved in the file.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_SERIES_NUMBERS
      The Default value for the series number, that is used, in case that the series number wasn't saved in the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm()
        This is the default constructor. This constructor setting the following defaults value:

        - subfolders = false

        - image digits = 5

        - protocol_digits = 3

        Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm(boolean subfolders)
        This constructor contains the following default setter: - image digits = 5

        - protocol digits = 3

        Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.

        Parameters:
        subfolders - The Options that deciding about the way the generated Directory is structured

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm(boolean subfolders,
                     int protocol_digits)
        This constructor contains the following default setter: - protocol digits = 3

        Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.

        Parameters:
        subfolders - This Options decides what the generated Directory looks like
        protocol_digits - The Number of digits, that should be at least in a Protocol name

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm(boolean subfolders,
                     int protocol_digits,
                     int img_digits)
        With this constructor, you can set all needed parameters at once, so you don't need any setter methods. Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.
        Parameters:
        subfolders - This Options changing the Structure of the generated Dictionary
        protocol_digits - The Number of digits, that a protocol should at least
        img_digits - The Number of digits, that a Image should have at least

    • Method Detail

      • setKeepImageName

        public void setKeepImageName(boolean keepit)
        This method is used, to decide, wether the Names of the files gonna be changened to their Image Number or if their keep their names.
        Parameters:
        keepit - true if the image name should not change; else false

      • setPrintStream

        public void setPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream out)
        The setPrinStream method can be used, to catch the output or the place, where it is printed.
        Parameters:
        out - The printstream, that should be used, for printing the progress

      • setImgDigits

        public void setImgDigits(int i)
        The imgDigits contains the information, how many digits are used to save the image number of a DICOM in the file name. If the image number of a DICOM is larger than the imgDigits number, than the image number of the DICOM is taken.
        Parameters:
        i - the amount of digits, that a Image Name should contain at least

      • setProtocolDigits

        public void setProtocolDigits(int i)
        The protocolDigits contains the Information how many digits are used at a special position. If subfolders is true, than protocolDigits contains the information for the number of digits for the subfolder of a protocol name folder. Else, the protocolDigits contains the information, how many digits are used as a prefix of a protocol folder.
        Parameters:
        i - The Number of Protocol digits that should be used at least.

      • useSubfolders

        public void useSubfolders(boolean useSubfolders)
        The boolean value subfolders contains the information, whether the different angel of the scans are sorted in subfolders in the protocol name directorys or the different angel are save as the protocol name with a certain prefix.
        Parameters:
        useSubfolders - The boolean that indicates, whether the Algorithm should use subfolders or not.

      • setFilesOptionCopy

        public void setFilesOptionCopy()
        Sets the Filetransferoption to copy.

      • setFilesOptionMove

        public void setFilesOptionMove()
        Sets the Filetransferoption to move.

      • setCreateNiftis

        public void setCreateNiftis(boolean createniftis)
        Defines, if the dicoms transfered as a dicom or as a nifty.
        Parameters:
        createniftis - true, if the found dicoms should be saved as a nifty; false otherwise

      • gotStopped

        public boolean gotStopped()
        This tells you, if someone forced the SortAlgorithm to stop the sort, with the stopSort() method.
        Returns:
        True, if the algorithm was stopped; else false

      • getPermissionProblem

        public boolean getPermissionProblem()
        Returns the information, if there was a problem with the permission.
        Returns:
        true, if there was a Problem to transfer/copy the Files; false else

      • stopSort

        public void stopSort()
        Method, to stop the Sort of another Thread.

      • searchAndSortIn

        public boolean searchAndSortIn(java.lang.String searchin,
                               java.lang.String sortInDir)
        This method searching in the path "searchin" for DICOMs and subfolders, which contains DICOMs. These DICOMs are sorted in the value "sortInDir". If "sortInDir" not exists, it gonna be created. To specify the behavior of this method, you can use the setter methods.
        Parameters:
        searchin - The Folder, where the Algorithm search for DICOMs.
        sortInDir - The Folder, where the Algorithm move and sort the DICOMs.
        Returns:
        True if sort algorithm wasn't stopped; else otherwise
